sentences.english: The wall was blackened by smoke.
Bigamy lightened the horizon of his shadowy thoughts for a moment.
sentences.chinese: 一时间，在他的思想中模模糊糊闪出了重婚这个念头。

sentences.english: Don't touch the book with your sticky fingers.
sentences.chinese: 别用你那黏糊糊的手指摸书。

sentences.english: Andy goes through the breakfast line, gets a scoop of glop on his tray.
sentences.chinese: 安迪走过早餐台，托盘里得到了一勺糊糊状的食品。

sentences.english: Thirty black beche-de-mer mate, sea cucumbers mate, writhing and squirting.
sentences.chinese: 三十个黑糊糊的海参正在里面蠕动喷射着。

sentences.english: He had lost all that dreamy vagueness and indecision.
sentences.chinese: 过去的梦游似的迷迷糊糊和优柔寡断早已不在。

sentences.english: Often find a friend or two to drink in a daze.
sentences.chinese: 常常找一两个朋友把自己喝的迷迷糊糊。

sentences.english: A man is vaguely aware of some short people living in the house。
sentences.chinese: 男人模模糊糊地知道和一些小人儿们住在一起。

sentences.english: The guy is always a little trippy.
sentences.chinese: 那个家伙成天迷迷糊糊的。

sentences.english: I have a better idea, " the Mulla replied sleepily."
sentences.chinese: “我有个好主意，”穆拉迷迷糊糊的回答。

sentences.english: Even if as for is not at a loss for words, also can only be ambiguous at least.
sentences.chinese: 即使不至于张口结舌，至少也只能含含糊糊。

sentences.english: Once in a while the sticky sauce pan is thoroughly scraped out.
sentences.chinese: 只一会就把这个粘糊糊的锅擦干净了。

sentences.english: He passed his hand across his forehead. It was dank with clammy sweat.
sentences.chinese: 他用手抹抹前额，额上满是湿漉漉粘糊糊的汗珠。

sentences.english: A glass of whisky soon muddles him.
sentences.chinese: 一杯威士忌很快就会把他醉得迷迷糊糊。

sentences.english: I had only an indistinct understanding of what was passing around me.
sentences.chinese: 我对于周围所发生的事只模模糊糊地知道一些。

sentences.english: Fill all but one section of the muffin tin, then stir the last bit of batter several minutes more.
sentences.chinese: 将一个松饼罐灌满，然后将剩下的糊糊多搅拌几分钟。

definition: to wake up/to be awake/to become aware/to sober up/to come to
paste/also written 漿糊|浆糊[jiang4 hu5]/Taiwan pr. [jiang4 hu2]
